abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings convey satisfactory project
            outcomes, a likely sustainability, and high institutional
            development impacts. Lessons are addressed through several
            subjects, mainly that sustainable input supply system is
            possible in the context of Rwanda, under the right set of
            policies, incentives and institutional mechanisms. Line Of
            Credit : Given the significant investment of large-scale
            importers in the input supply business, there is a need to
            ensure profitability and greater knowledge of inputs on the
            part of suppliers. Small Farmer Import Credit Facility : The
            combination of revolving scheme in rural areas, and the
            targeted training of farmers in the use, and management of
            credit represents a major break through in terms of access
            to credit, and modern inputs for farmers. Nonetheless, local
            leaders need to be sensitized on the management of input
            credit. Input Credit Insurance Facility: Clear mechanisms,
            guided by specific criteria should be established to assess
            the extent of natural disasters damage experienced by
            farmers, which was not evident in the implementation
            procedures, whereas resources need to be managed by a
            competent institution, such as an insurance firm,
            agricultural banking, or micro-finance institution;
            Extension System : The lead farmer extension system should
            be adopted at the national level, and the concept broadened,
            to be replicated to other sectors for developmental
            activities. Further subjects address the need for farmers
            training programs, for seed multiplication and distribution
            activities, for agricultural technology development and
            transfer, and, for agricultural marketing poles, and private
            sector investment.
